meanings.definition: One of a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct or procedure within a particular area of activity.
meanings.sent1: The school has a strict rule about no running in the hallways.
meanings.sent2: Following the traffic rules is important for everyone's safety.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book look sad? Because it had too many problems to rule over!
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen rules the board with her strategic moves.
meanings.sent5: The golden rule of treating others as you want to be treated is a valuable lesson.

meanings.definition: A strip of wood or other rigid material used for measuring length or marking straight lines.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a long rule to measure the length of the table.
meanings.sent2: She drew a perfect straight line using a ruler in art class.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ruler refuse to measure anything? It didn't want to be a part of the straight world!
meanings.sent4: The ruler of the land marked the boundaries with a golden ruler.
meanings.sent5: The tailor used a measuring rule to ensure the dress fit perfectly.
